page.title: 12Scotter - The Village
page.content: Scotter has grown quickly,the population more than doubling in the last{20 years.}New houses have been built on large estates throughout the village.Houses vary greatly in size and style.The{Parish Council}has no direct control over what is built and can only make recommendations.For several years they have been fighting a legal battle over the style of one house.In a survey people stated that they thought the village was now too{ {large.}The majority of people regard Scotter as a peaceful,friendly village in pretty surroundings.The building of the village hall has caused much discussion.Some people believe it is too large and too far from the centre of the village.Most see it as a valuable amenity with its large hall, liscensed bar,well equipped kitchen and rooms for local groups to use.
